connector.description: Send and receive messages from NATS messaging system.

camel.sink.path.topic.name: camel.sink.path.topic
camel.sink.path.topic.description: The name of topic we want to use

camel.sink.endpoint.flushConnection.name: camel.sink.endpoint.flushConnection
camel.sink.endpoint.flushConnection.description: Define if we want to flush connection when stopping or not

camel.sink.endpoint.maxPingsOut.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxPingsOut
camel.sink.endpoint.maxPingsOut.description: maximum number of pings have not received a response allowed by the client

camel.sink.endpoint.noEcho.name: camel.sink.endpoint.noEcho
camel.sink.endpoint.noEcho.description: Turn off echo. If supported by the gnatsd version you are connecting to this flag will prevent the server from echoing messages back to the connection if it has subscriptions on the subject being published to.

camel.sink.endpoint.noRandomizeServers.name: camel.sink.endpoint.noRandomizeServers
camel.sink.endpoint.noRandomizeServers.description: Whether or not randomizing the order of servers for the connection attempts

camel.sink.endpoint.pedantic.name: camel.sink.endpoint.pedantic
camel.sink.endpoint.pedantic.description: Whether or not running in pedantic mode (this affects performance)

camel.sink.endpoint.pingInterval.name: camel.sink.endpoint.pingInterval
camel.sink.endpoint.pingInterval.description: Ping interval to be aware if connection is still alive (in milliseconds)

camel.sink.endpoint.reconnect.name: camel.sink.endpoint.reconnect
camel.sink.endpoint.reconnect.description: Whether or not using reconnection feature

camel.sink.endpoint.reconnectTimeWait.name: camel.sink.endpoint.reconnectTimeWait
camel.sink.endpoint.reconnectTimeWait.description: Waiting time before attempts reconnection (in milliseconds)

camel.sink.endpoint.requestCleanupInterv.name: camel.sink.endpoint.requestCleanupInterval
camel.sink.endpoint.requestCleanupInterv.description: Interval to clean up cancelled/timed out requests.

camel.sink.endpoint.servers.name: camel.sink.endpoint.servers
camel.sink.endpoint.servers.description: URLs to one or more NAT servers. Use comma to separate URLs when specifying multiple servers.

camel.sink.endpoint.verbose.name: camel.sink.endpoint.verbose
camel.sink.endpoint.verbose.description: Whether or not running in verbose mode

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.replySubject.name: camel.sink.endpoint.replySubject
camel.sink.endpoint.replySubject.description: the subject to which subscribers should send response

camel.sink.endpoint.connection.name: camel.sink.endpoint.connection
camel.sink.endpoint.connection.description: Reference an already instantiated connection to Nats server

camel.sink.endpoint.traceConnection.name: camel.sink.endpoint.traceConnection
camel.sink.endpoint.traceConnection.description: Whether or not connection trace messages should be printed to standard out for fine grained debugging of connection issues.

camel.sink.endpoint.secure.name: camel.sink.endpoint.secure
camel.sink.endpoint.secure.description: Set secure option indicating TLS is required

camel.component.nats.servers.name: camel.component.nats.servers
camel.component.nats.servers.description: URLs to one or more NAT servers. Use comma to separate URLs when specifying multiple servers.

camel.component.nats.verbose.name: camel.component.nats.verbose
camel.component.nats.verbose.description: Whether or not running in verbose mode

camel.component.nats.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.nats.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.nats.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.nats.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.nats.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.nats.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.nats.useGlobalSslContext.name: camel.component.nats.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.nats.useGlobalSslContext.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
